column5: Big fat piece of Chicken Liver retrieved slowly over and through a weed bed. Try to keep the liver just below the surface so AV doesent try to eat it.
Go find something bettet to do with your time! NWO Fishing Bum
My favorite is a bottom bouncer with a 2 hook spinner rig trolled at 0.9 mph.
>Position fishing with a 1/8 oz jig and a very fat leach. >Works every time. Not as good in colder water. Those leaches tend to curl up when it's early in the season.
Interesting, I keep mine in the fridge and never had them curel up. I don't fish up there right after ice out so that might be the differance.
Interesting, I keep mine in the fridge and never had them curel up. I don't fish up there right after ice out so that might be the differance.
My favourite as well...Very effective and very relaxing.
My favourite as well...Very effective and very relaxing.
When times are tough, a #2 octopus hook with a leech. Small split shot 18 inches up. Nothing else.
When times are tough, a #2 octopus hook with a leech. Small split shot 18 inches up. Nothing else.
I like slip bobbin'.
Ditto the leech and plain hook. Pooch

Since I am about losing it thinking about fishing in Canada, I thought it might be interesting to share what worked best for you last year (or everyday if you're a Canadian). For me, an electric blue 4" twister on a black/gold sparkle 3/8 ounce jighead was the hot lure last year. Other colors with lots of sparkles also did well. I worked these jigs on current breaks, windy points, and in thick timber (Ogoki Reservoir). It was the first time I ever gave some of these colors much of a chance. Wish I would have done it sooner. Wow guys, nobody wants to share?
Cranks. In particular, the Rapala Deep Tail Dancer.

I too am an avid jig fisherman. I tip with various baits and use various sizes to 1/2 oz. I make my own and my favourite colour is chartreuse. On many days I have done the best with unpainted or natural lead colour. I prefer to hunt the fish with the heavier jigs to stay on bottom and then move to a lighter slower presentation when I find a good group. I also like to vertical fish with live bait right beside the boat while anchored just like ice fishing. Works real well.
I live in Toronto and I fish the Kawartha region extensively in the spring and absolutely nothing beats the hair jig. A 7'6" flipping stick and 50 lb Power Pro line. :cheers:
My favorite is drifting a bottom bouncer with a spinner rig.
>My favorite is drifting a bottom bouncer with a spinner rig. Is it hard to keep the bouncer from laying down when drifting?

Not fished straight down. Just tap it to the bottom every few seconds to make sure you are close. "Carry" it, the bulk of the time. It works well, especially in stained water, or when drifting in a little deeper water.

>Not fished straight down. Just tap it to the bottom every few >seconds to make sure you are close. "Carry" it, the bulk of >the time. >It works well, especially in stained water, or when drifting >in a little deeper water. Great, thanks.

As the other person said, not hard just use the proper weight and shoot for 45 degrees and just tickle the bottom. Of course, it the drift is too slow - add some power to make it work better. But someone asked for favorite and mine is drifting a bouncer rather than trolling becuase it is silent.
Position fishing with a 1/8 oz jig and a very fat leach. Works every time.
